text: The Karachi Agreement was a cease-fire agreement signed by Pakistan and India on the 27th of July 1949. It established a cease-fire line which could be monitored by observers from the United Nations. The Agreement was signed by the following: * Major General W. J Cawthorn, Government of Pakistan. * Lieutenanat-General S.M Shrinagesh, Government of India. * Hernando Samper and M Delvoie United Nations Commission for India and Pakistan. Category:1940s in Pakistan Category:1940s in India Category:1949 in Asia
title: Karachi Agreement
